title: Freddie Hubbard - 1963 - Hub-Tones (SACD 24 88.2 2011) FLAC
description:
Freddie Hubbard - 1963 - Hub-Tones (2011)
SACD 24 bits, 88.2 KHz

Trumpeter Freddie Hubbard teams up on record with James Spaulding (who doubles on alto and flute) for the first time on this excellent set, with the assistance of pianist Herbie Hancock, bassist Reggie Workman, and drummer Clifford Jarvis. The quintet performs four of the trumpeter's originals (including "Lament for Booker" and the title cut) plus an advanced version of the standard "You're My Everything." John Coltrane's modal music was starting to influence Hubbard's conception and his own playing was pushing the modern mainstream ahead without really entering the avant-garde. (AllMusic)

Track list:
01. You're My Everything
02. Prophet Jennings
03. Hub-Tones
04. Lament For Booker
05. For Spee's Sake
06. You're My Everything (Alternate Take)
07. Hub-Tones (Alternate Take)
08. For Spee's Sake (Alternate Take)

Personnel:
Freddie Hubbard - trumpet
James Spaulding - flute, alto sax
Herbie Hancock - piano
Reggie Workman - bass
Clifford Jarvis - drums
